name.text: Calculating the Area Swept by a Windscreen Wiper

questiontext.text:
The shaded region in the diagram below represents the area swept out by a windscreen wiper on a flat windscreen. Calculate the area of the shaded region correct to \(3\,\text{decimal places}\).

[[jsxgraph]] var brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-12, 12, 12, -12], // bigger bounding box axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Centre of rotation var O = brd.create('point', [-2, -2], {visible: false}); // Outer and inner radii var R_outer = 10; // increased for visibility var R_inner = 6; // inner radius var angle = 2 * Math.PI / 3; // 120° // Outer sector var P = brd.create('point', [O.X() + R_outer, O.Y()], {visible: false}); var Q = brd.create('point', [O.X() + R_outer * Math.cos(angle), O.Y() + R_outer * Math.sin(angle)], {visible: false}); brd.create('sector', [O, P, Q], { fillOpacity: 0.2, strokeWidth: 2, strokeColor: 'black' }); // Inner sector (to cut out center) var Pin = brd.create('point', [O.X() + R_inner, O.Y()], {visible: false}); var Qin = brd.create('point', [O.X() + R_inner * Math.cos(angle), O.Y() + R_inner * Math.sin(angle)], {visible: false}); brd.create('sector', [O, Pin, Qin], { fillColor: 'white', fillOpacity: 1, strokeWidth: 0 }); // Hatching lines between inner and outer arcs for (var t = 0; t <= 1; t += 0.05) { (function (s) { var a = angle * s; var x1 = O.X() + R_inner * Math.cos(a), y1 = O.Y() + R_inner * Math.sin(a); var x2 = O.X() + R_outer * Math.cos(a), y2 = O.Y() + R_outer * Math.sin(a); brd.create('segment', [[x1, y1], [x2, y2]], { strokeColor: 'BLUE', strokeWidth: 1 }); })(t); } // Base line along one radius var baseEnd = brd.create('point', [O.X() + R_outer, O.Y()], {visible: false}); brd.create('segment', [O, baseEnd], {strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 2}); brd.create('text', [O.X() + R_outer / 2 - 1, O.Y() - 1, '{#R#} cm']); // Angle marker 120° brd.create('angle', [baseEnd, O, Q], { radius: 2, name: '{#theta#}°' }); // Wiper label brd.create('text', [ O.X() + (R_inner + 0.5) * Math.cos(angle), O.Y() + (R_inner + 3) * Math.sin(angle), 'Wiper' ]); // Label the wiper distance 4 cm brd.create('text', [ O.X() - R_outer / 2, O.Y() + 6, '{#Wiper#} cm' ]); [[/jsxgraph]]

\(\text{Area of the region swept}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution:

The shaded region represents the area swept out by the windscreen wiper. From the diagram:

  • Sector angle: {@theta@}°
  • Outer radius of the sweep: {@R@} cm
  • Wiper length: {@Wiper@} cm

Step 1: Find the inner radius (r) of the sector.

\(\begin{align} r &= R - \text{Wiper length} \\ &= {@R@} - {@Wiper@} \\ &= {@r@}\ \text{cm} \end{align}\)

Step 2: Write the formula for the area of an annular sector.

\(\begin{align} A &= \frac{\theta}{360} \pi (R^2 - r^2) \end{align}\)

Step 3: Substitute the values and compute the area.

\(\begin{align} A &= \frac{@theta@}{360} \times \frac{22}{7} \times \left( {@R@}^2 - {@r@}^2 \right) \\ &=\frac{@theta@}{360} \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@R_1@}-{@r_1@} \\ &=\frac{@theta@}{360} \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@Radius_difference@} \\ &={@A@}\\ &= {@A_3sf@}\ \text{cm}^2 \end{align}\)

Therefore,
the area of the region swept by the wiper is \({@A_3sf@}\,\text{cm}^2\) (correct to 3 decimal places).

\(\text{The area of the region swept}={@A_3sf@}\,\text{cm}^2\)
